Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred in determining residency and providing adequate reasons
Evidence_Type: Residency records, self-reported days of presence
Legal_Provision: Residence requirement of 1,095 days within four years
Basis_of_Claim: Alleged failure to meet physical presence requirement
Evaluation_Standard: One of three tests: physical presence, qualitative attachment, or centralization of existence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of clarity on which test was applied and inadequate analysis of contradictions
Proceeding_Type: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Application_Error: Failure to specify applicable test and reconcile inconsistent evidence
Legal_Standard: Residency requirement and duty to provide transparent, intelligible reasons
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and correctness of residency assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Citizenship Act â€“ residency requirement (1,095 days)
Outcome_of_Review: Appeal allowed, remanded to a different citizenship judge
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient reasoning and unaddressed credibility issues
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide adequate reasons affecting fairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Minister challenged approval based on insufficient presence and reasoning
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasons undermining transparency and accountability
Omission_Type: Failure to identify and apply correct legal test
